$description:
| What does this do? | Implements a series of restrictions to protect Teams meetings. These include ensuring anonymous users can't join a meeting and anonymous users and dial-in callers can't start a meeting; only people in your organizaiton can bypass the lobby; users dialing in cannot bypass the lobby; the meeting chat does not allow anonymous users; only organizers and co-organizers can present; external participants can't give or request control; external meeting chat is off. |
| Why should you use this? | This allows organizers to secure Teams calls and protect company data by preventing anyone not directly from the organization or unauthorized users from joining meetings, bypassing the lobby, starting calls, and presenting on calls. |
| What is the end-user impact? | User education is required. |
| Learn more | [Configure meeting settings](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/defender-office-365/step-by-step-guides/reducing-attack-surface-in-microsoft-teams?view=o365-worldwide#configure-meeting-settings) [Control who can bypass the lobby](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/who-can-bypass-meeting-lobby?WT.mc_id=TeamsAdminCenterCSH#control-who-can-bypass-the-lobby) |
